title: Super Slow Downloading/Patching
body:
Whenever patching, it is painfully slow (50-80KBytes/s) and takes over an hour. It's not related to traffic because i can still download other things at full speed (over 1MByte/s) no problems. Anyway after doing some digging it seems patch files are hosted/cached by the same people as EA's Origin - Akamai, and people using origin also experience slow downloads. How do i fix this?

tracert:
C:\Users\John>tracert l3cdn.riotgames.com

Tracing route to a1158.g.akamai.net [202.124.127.104]
over a maximum of 30 hops:

  1    <1 ms    <1 ms    <1 ms  EA3500 [192.168.0.1]
  2     2 ms     2 ms     1 ms  192.168.1.1
  3    31 ms    26 ms    32 ms  wlg-cust-1-lo-1.actrix.co.nz [192.100.53.6]
  4    40 ms    44 ms     *     wlg-core-2-gi-0-0-0-19-10.actrix.co.nz [192.100.53.81]
  5    33 ms    33 ms    29 ms  192.100.53.93
  6    32 ms    42 ms    42 ms  72.62.69.111.static.snap.net.nz [111.69.62.72]
  7    39 ms    36 ms    34 ms  73.62.69.111.static.snap.net.nz [111.69.62.73]
  8    26 ms    26 ms    28 ms  104.127.124.202.static.snap.net.nz [202.124.127.104]

C:\Users\John>nslookup l3cdn.riotgames.com

C:\Users\John>nslookup l3cdn.riotgames.com 208.67.222.222
Server:  resolver1.opendns.com
Address:  208.67.222.222

Non-authoritative answer:
Name:    a1158.g.akamai.net
Addresses:  202.124.127.104
          202.124.127.105
Aliases:  l3cdn.riotgames.com
          akacdn.riotgames.com.edgesuite.net

I notice the last hop of the trace has a lower ping than most of the earlier ones, does this mean my isp is spraying packets all over the place?

replies.body:
Hi John,

No idea what's up with the last loop having a lower ping. Might be that it used a different route altogether. Have you tried flushing your DNS?

uuuuugh I hate it when stuff like this happens. It feels so out of your control you just want to punch some shmuck in the face.

For the moment I suggest experimenting with different DNS's. Probably won't do anything but if you're out of ideas, may as well try.

Do you have some other way of connecting to the internet to compare your connection, eg. smartphone wifi hotspot?
